properties.name: Blue Building
properties.description: Posted by Jake When it rained, there were some nice curbs in this PSU building.

properties.name: Downhilling on Mt Tabor!
properties.description: Posted by Jake portlandUsed to roll with Mike Norton, still a good spot.

properties.name: Fred Meyer Banks
properties.description: Posted by JakeThese banks were pretty rough, but skate-able. Dodging in and out of grocery trucks in an industrial area was probably the most fun.

properties.name: Holladay
properties.description: Posted by Jake Right around the corner from Youngson. Team Studhorse threw contests here. Kenny, redhead Al, Mike, Mark Plieth all used to early grab off the jump ramp.

properties.name: Jake going big backside
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrOld Skatespot - Intern house vert rampNo longer available vert ramp. Home to Jake Olsen, Mike R, and company.

properties.name: Lovejoy Parking garage
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrPlenty of places to skate under here including a bank to wall, and some curbs. Dare to try it now!!!

properties.name: Montgomery Ward Building
properties.description: Posted by Jake With rain so prevalent in Portland, this was a popular spot. Curbs, manuals, and ledges made this place the spot many nights and weekends, after the workers (and cars) left.

properties.name: Nice waxed curb, circa 1989
properties.description: Posted by Jake Used to skate here with Dave Yong and Dan Garland.

properties.name: Nimbus Banks
properties.description: Posted by JasonThe entire industrial park is filled with smooth loading dock banks, some mellow, some steep. Not sure it\'s still a skateable.

properties.name: Portland Public School Head Offices
properties.description: Posted by Jason Nearly abandoned, old skate spot.

properties.name: Ryan Lee's Jump Ramp
properties.description: Posted by JasonBuilt to match some ramp in some video, this was a serious launcher, over 3 ft tall. Skated it with Tommy G. on one of his trips to Portland, also same session was with danny sargent and dan feldman (who was doing frontside 360 ollie whippits off the side of the ramp to 50/50 on the curb. muffin was always seriously sick! G&S yo) :)

properties.name: Schools Public - Portland School District No 1 J, Elementary Schools-Portland, Youngson
properties.description: Posted by System 2704 Southeast 71st Avenue, Portland, OR, 97206Schools Public - Portland School District No 1 J, Elementary Schools-Portland, Youngson 503503-916668-63835541

properties.name: Tigard Theatre Banks
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  11626 SW Pacific Hwy. Tigard, OR 97223During construction of the theatre, we often skated it at night with the help of large halogen lights. In one of the theatres there was a wide smooth bank that now goes up to the movie screen. We skated this for about a month in the late 80\'\'s.

properties.name: Waterfront Promenade
properties.description: Posted by Jake Back in the day, summertime, skating the ledges, people throwing their boards into the Willamette, ollieing the three, only to learn Matt Beach, or was it Jamie Fortune, backside 180\'ed it the next week. What a bummer, ego was busted!

properties.name: Westover Banks
properties.description: Posted by Jake brick banks similar to kgw, first skated her with bennington

properties.name: bank at the bank
properties.description: Posted by Jake old skatespot, now ruined by bark, used to skate here with mike, kyle and barry

properties.name: creston
properties.description: Posted by Jake old skate spot, ripped by Leonard Houx, skated here with Yong, Garland and Mueller

properties.name: kgw banks
properties.description: Posted by Jake blunt slides on waxed brick, ahhhhhh

properties.name: newberg skatepark
properties.description: Posted by Mcsktwhrntsposd2 1299 S Blaine stPros say: World-famous skater Tony Hawk reports: "Newberg possesses the "best cement contours I\'ve ever ridden, by far." Professional boarder Alex Chalmers says: "Newberg belongs on his "top five list of skateparks around the world," and it\'s for this reason Alex adds: "Oregon is about to become a hotbed for amazing burly skateboarders." Thrasher Skateboard Magazine again treated Dreamland with unprecedented international coverage, judging Newberg "the best [skatepark] in the world... rated an 11 out of a possible 10. Ten is just not loud enough."

properties.name: terribly rough, small and crappy bank
properties.description: Posted by Jasonnw northrup, near 18th, portland, ori\'m sure it used to get sessioned hardcore, in the 80\'s. could be a fun launch with kryptos and a vigorous uphill push.
